poem:
**In the Margins of Power**

In shadows where the ink dries cold,  
power scribes with hands unclean.  
The margins hold what truth denies;  
a tale where justice turned unseen.  
A birthday marked by lines of fame,  
etched by those who play the game.  
Yet whispers live where silence chose,  
in every word, the conscience froze.
